text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALE - Pakistan over the weekend bought a total of 315,000 tonnes wheat, 180,000 tonnes of which was Australian origin and 135,000 tonnes of which was U.S. wheat for February 1-28 delivery, several U.S. exporters said.
- Philippine firms bought 40,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for February shipment, traders said on Monday.
SOYMEAL SALE - The Korea Feed Association on Monday bought 30,000 to 35,000 tonnes of Indian soymeal from Singapore-based trading house Peter Cremer, traders said.

WHEAT TENDER -Algeria launched a tender to import 75,000 tonnes of optional soft wheat, European grain traders said on Monday. Algeria launched the tender late on Sunday and exporters must submit their offers on Monday, traders said. Algeria is seeking to import 50,000 tonnes of optional soft wheat for shipment between February 25 and March 10 and another 25,000 tonnes for shipment in the first half of March.

- Armenia is seeking about 65,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat under the PL 480 program for January 23-February 6 delivery, its U.S. export agent said. Offers are to be submitted on January 15 and will be valid until January 16.

WHEAT TENDERS - Yemen has postponed a tender for soft wheat grain and soft wheat flour initially scheduled for January 7 until January 14, grain traders said. Yemen is seeking 200,000 tonnes of European or U.S soft wheat flour for shipment by June. Within the EU Yemen is seeking French, Dutch, German or Belgian flour. It also seeks 200,000 tonnes of optional soft wheat for shipment between June and August.
- Lebanon's economy ministry plans to buy 50,000 tonnes of U.S. hard wheat later this month, the Cereals and Sugar Beet Office said. "It will be Hard Red Winter No.2," the official said.

WHEAT TENDER - Bangladesh seeks 100,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 wheat or Australian standard or better Canadian winter red/spring wheat for shipment by February 21. Offers are to be opened Jan 18 and results announced two to three days later.
SOYMEAL TENDER - South Korea's Korea Feed Association will invite tenders for 125,000 tonnes of soymeal on Monday. The tenders were divided into four positions for March 20.

BARLEY TENDER - The Cyprus Grain Commission said on Monday it has invited tenders for the supply of one cargo of 25,000 tonnes of feed barley, with the tender closing January 17 and shipment between January 22 and February 5.
CORN TENDER - South Africa's Maize Board said on Monday it would offer by a tender 15,000 tonnes of yellow maize for either export or domestic use. The offer would close Jan 16.
CORN AND SOYBEAN TENDER - Taiwan traders said on Monday they expect to see perhaps two tenders this week for up to 70,000 tonnes of U.S. corn and 38,000 tonnes of soybeans.

SOYBEAN MEAL TENDER - The Commodity Credit Corp said it seeks offers from exporters for 2,650 tonnes of 48 percent protein soybean meal for donation to Guatemala. Shipment is slated for between January 30 and February 25, 1997. Offers are due on January 14 at 1400 CST.
RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organization for Chemicals and Foodstuffs is seeking to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for March shipment. Results would be Feb 13.

MARKET TALK - Bangladesh has tendered to buy Australian, Canadian or U.S. wheat under an 850 million yen Japanese food aid for shipment by February 24, government and Japanese embassy officials said. Food ministry officials said bidding would take place at 0630 GMT on January 25. However, they would not specify the quantity of the wheat. The embassy officials said the Japanese government offered the money as a grant to import the wheat under an agreement signed on November 19.
